doc.previous: Since orthogonal transformations preserve inner products, it follows that and thus the are perpendicular. In other words the geometric product of two distinct vectors is completely specified by their outer product, or more generally
doc.after: Therefore every blade of grade r can be written as a geometric product of r vectors. More generally, if a degenerate geometric algebra is allowed, then the orthogonal matrix is replaced by a block matrix that is orthogonal in the nondegenerate block, and the diagonal matrix has zero-valued entries along the degenerate dimensions.
